channel.title: Apartment Therapy | Saving the world, one room at a time
channel.description: Saving the world, one room at a time

item.title: Renovation Diary: What's New This Week — March 18- 22, 2013
item.description:
• Seth & Allison's Kitchen: New Windows!
• Andi's Kitchen: Ups and Downs and Big Decisions
• Claire & Jeffrey's Kitchen: Taking Care of the Basics
• Maxwell & Ursula's Light Rental Reno: Inspiration

Seth and Allison got some snazzy new windows, Andi invested in some beautiful coved ceilings, and Claire and Jeffrey took care of some unglamorous stuff that just had to be done. Meanwhile, in New York, Maxwell and Urusula's light rental reno continued, with some pretty exciting results.
item.author: Nancy Mitchell

item.title: Naimah's Space to Dance Bedroom — My Bedroom Retreat Contest
item.description:
Like this My Bedroom Retreat contest entry? Favorite it below!
Name:
Naimah
Location:
Kuala Lumpur Malaysia
Division:
International
What do you love about your bedroom?:
The space. It's a huge room and I'm happy to have the space to dance! I also love the stream of daylight from the windows.


More
item.author: Jason Loper

item.title: Jenn's Soothing Elements Bedroom — My Bedroom Retreat Contest
item.description:
Like this My Bedroom Retreat contest entry? Favorite it below!
Name:
Jenn
Location:
Vancouver, Bc Canada
Division:
International
What do you love about your bedroom?:
I love the soothing warm colours and feel to our bedroom. We filled our room with objects we love that we've found on our travels or when out in nature. Our room is a relaxing retreat for us because of the natural elements we included in our room: canvas, linen, brass, driftwood, candles, leather, crystals, organic cotton, lace. Our room has a lovely energy, making it such a nice room to relax in. Our kitties, Gigi and Franklin, seem love it too.


More
item.author: Jason Loper

item.description:

What do you love about your bedroom?:
The color! My daughter picked this rich, deep purple and it's beautiful. It's elegant without being overpowering and I love the crisp contrast against the white molding.

item.author: Jason Loper

item.title: Find Your Favorites: Saturday's Entries — My Bedroom Retreat Contest
item.description:
There have been so many amazing entries in our inaugural Bedroom Contest that we're spilling over into the weekend. Check out today's fourteen new entries and if you like what you see, be sure to click the heart on their post to make them a "favorite" and help move them up on the leaderboard.

  • Cynthia's Calm Retreat Bedroom
  • Joy's Beach Lovers Bedroom
  • Laura's Simple White Walled Bedroom
  • Maria's Art Arrangement Bedroom
  • Lauren's Resourceful Style Bedroom
  • Sabrina's Black & White Bedroom
  • Caroline's Southern Charm Bedroom
  • Rachel's Teeny Terrier Sanctuary Bedroom
  • Laura's DIY Style Bedroom
  • Kaisa's Peaceful Atmosphere
  • Allister's Surrounded by History Bedroom
  • Larissa's Blue Brooklyn Bedroom
  • Averyl's Colorful Eclectic Bedroom
  • Han's Luxury on a Budget

More
item.author: Jason Loper

item.title: Han's Luxury on a Budget — My Bedroom Retreat Contest
item.description:
Like this My Bedroom Retreat contest entry? Favorite it below!
Name:
Han
Location:
Brooklyn, NY
Division:
United States
What do you love about your bedroom?:
I love that the room looks luxurious yet it was put together on a small budget. People have a hard time believing that the pair of white chairs (which are almost brand new) was $175!! Almost every furniture piece was from Craigslist, eBay or thrift stores, the only splurge was our bed. We are DIYers and I had the plan of doing my own headboard to save on money. But at the time, we were deep into our house gut-renovation and with a wedding to plan also, I figured it would be money well spent to save some of our sanity. I also love waking up to the soft-filtered light through the white curtains on a sunny weekend morning, seeing the photos of our travels on the walls and just feel so blessed to have a house to create our own, and wonderful family and friends, who are so encouraging on my passion for design and since seeing our house have asked me to design their spaces!


More
item.author: Jason Loper

item.title: Averyl's Colorful Eclectic Bedroom — My Bedroom Retreat Contest
item.description:
Like this My Bedroom Retreat contest entry? Favorite it below!
Name:
Averyl
Location:
Richardson, TX
Division:
United States
What do you love about your bedroom?:
I love all the color and vibrancy that brings light and warmth to the room. I enjoy having things that are old (the vintage agricultural education poster, box I bought when visiting Bahrain, Dixie Shangri-la nightstands etc.) with the new (wall of closets, headboard, lamps etc.). I also love that it is always a work in progress.


More
item.author: Jason Loper

item.title: Larissa's Blue Brooklyn Bedroom — My Bedroom Retreat Contest
item.description:
Like this My Bedroom Retreat contest entry? Favorite it below!
Name:
Larissa
Location:
Brooklyn, NY

What do you love about your bedroom?:
I love that I can see airplanes on the flight path to LaGuardia from my bed at night. They are a comforting presence.


More
item.author: Jason Loper

item.title: Allister's Surrounded by History Bedroom — My Bedroom Retreat Contest
item.description:
Like this My Bedroom Retreat contest entry? Favorite it below!
Name:
Allister
Location:
Nashville, TN
Division:
United States
What do you love about your bedroom?:
The home was built in the late 1800's and I love that I'm surrounded by history. The aged architecture creates a very calming space. When the sunlight beams through the tall windows in the morning I'm ready to start my day, and in the evening, when the candles are lit and I pick up a book to read, I can't help but think of how many before me have done the same thing.


More
item.author: Jason Loper

item.description:

I love the brown natural wood shelf which I received as a housewarming gift from my mother in law.


More
item.author: Jason Loper

item.title: Laura's DIY Style Bedroom — My Bedroom Retreat Contest
item.description:
Like this My Bedroom Retreat contest entry? Favorite it below!
Name:
Laura
Location:
Penrith Australia
Division:
International
What do you love about your bedroom?:
Being constantly inspired by the fabulous home DIY blogs I have tried my hand at a few projects. Our bedroom is filled with homemade items which creates a personal and sentimental feel for the room. The pillowcases, felt garland, artwork, bedside table and dresser are all DIY projects. Our bedroom is tiny but we love it because it is filled with touches of our personality.


More
item.author: Jason Loper

item.title: Rachel's Teeny Terrier Sanctuary Bedroom — My Bedroom Retreat Contest
item.description:
Like this My Bedroom Retreat contest entry? Favorite it below!
Name:
Rachel
Location:
Los Angeles, CA
Division:
United States
What do you love about your bedroom?:
I love the family artwork that we have up, and the headboard that my awesome husband made. The storage that we have under the bed is sooo nice to have, and I'm in love with the grey that we painted the walls. (I may just give in and paint every single room of our apartment that color). Our room also gets the most amazing late-afternoon golden sunlight if I'm not too lazy to open the curtains.


More
item.author: Jason Loper

item.author: Dabney Frake

item.title: Caroline's Southern Charm Bedroom — My Bedroom Retreat Contest
item.description:
Like this My Bedroom Retreat contest entry? Favorite it below!
Name:
Caroline
Location:
Winston Salem, NC
Division:
United States
What do you love about your bedroom?:
My downtown front porch is a southern hotspot for hello's and how are ya's. The chorus of city sounds surrounds my building. But once inside my room, the hubbub hushes and the house speaks for itself. Sure, I filled it with me and mine. But that for which I'm not responsible is what I love most - the creaky wood floor, each door a different size, the crumbly paint painted over too many times. I had to compromise with the architecture, to complement its vintage character with my own collection of aged, second-hand belongings. I feel that interior design is a conversation that doesn't end until you move and start a new one. My bedroom and I are still talking. But we're getting somewhere. I wish you could come sit in here, the shifting light is just beautiful in the afternoon.


More
item.author: Jason Loper

item.title: Sabrina's Black & White Bedroom — My Bedroom Retreat Contest
item.description:
Like this My Bedroom Retreat contest entry? Favorite it below!
Name:
Sabrina
Location:
Palo Alto, CA
Division:
United States
What do you love about your bedroom?:
I love how cohesive my bedroom is. I feel calm knowing that everything follows a certain theme. I also love the light. When I woke up the first morning in my room, I thought that I accidentally left the light on because it was so bright.


More
item.author: Jason Loper

item.title: Lauren's Resourceful Style Bedroom — My Bedroom Retreat Contest
item.description:
Like this My Bedroom Retreat contest entry? Favorite it below!
Name:
Lauren
Location:
Pawtucket, RI
Division:
United States
What do you love about your bedroom?:
Lily and I absolutely love the high ceilings and exposed brick. We have a good mix of old and new: a letterpress from 1915 and furniture we have purchased over time. I also love that we have been resourceful with how we have put our room together. We are both young professionals with big dreams and small incomes, so a lot of furniture was customized by us along with the rest of the apartment.


More
item.author: Jason Loper

item.title: Maria's Art Arrangement Bedroom — My Bedroom Retreat Contest
item.description:
Like this My Bedroom Retreat contest entry? Favorite it below!
Name:
Maria
Location:
San Jose, CA
Division:
United States
What do you love about your bedroom?:
I love the big window, the turquoise walls, and all the colorful art. I've heard that bedrooms should be more subdued and relaxing, but I'd quickly get bored with a subdued room, plus, I can't see any of the art when the lights are off, so going to sleep is not a problem. I love having a TV in the bedroom, but I didn't want it to be a focal point in the room, so I hid it in a frame collage. When the TV is on, it looks like moving art!


More
item.author: Jason Loper

item.title: Laura's Simple White Walled Bedroom — My Bedroom Retreat Contest
item.description:
Like this My Bedroom Retreat contest entry? Favorite it below!
Name:
Laura
Location:
Brooklyn, NY
Division:
United States
What do you love about your bedroom?:
The big windows, high ceilings, maple floors. I have lived in my apartment for 23 years and have tried various sleeping arrangements: a loft bed, a single bed, several different full-size beds (with headboard and without). What I've got now seems to work well and is very versatile. I just need to paint a wall and change the sheets/blanket, and it's a new room. Some of the photos show recent, different versions of my bedroom. The large painting in front of the window was a curbside find. I live on a really noisy street and the windows face south, so it's bright. The painting gives me a bit more privacy.


More
item.author: Jason Loper

item.title: 8 Ways to Rescue a Rental Bathroom — Renters Solutions
item.description:
Following up on last weekend's post, 7 Ways to Rescue a Rental Kitchen, this week I'm looking at temporary solutions for the bathroom. From floor covering to shower heads, here are 8 ways to make the best of even the most vintage bathroom.

More
item.author: Jason Loper

item.title: Joy's Beach Lovers Bedroom — My Bedroom Retreat Contest
item.description:
Like this My Bedroom Retreat contest entry? Favorite it below!
Name:
Joy
Location:
Fairfax, VA
Division:
United States
What do you love about your bedroom?:
My husband and I are avid beach-lovers and design enthusiasts, so I love that our room is a moody blend of both. Rustic beach house meets sophisticated comfort. Some of my favorite things are the gray linen headboard which I DIY'ed when I was 9 months pregnant (I don't recommend this...) and the pallet wood frame I built for the Wyeth print hanging above the dresser. We also picked out the piece of driftwood from a little roadside shop on one of our vacations. These things make the room feel like it is actually ours and not just a pretty space. I love how the layered textures and graphic, monochromatic patterns combine to create an atmosphere of relaxed sophistication.


More
item.author: Jason Loper

item.title: 3 Minutes to a More Organized Home — Apartment Therapy Video Roundup
item.description:
This week, Fay Wolf shared with us how to make your life easier by storing things where you use them. Here's that video and two more of Fay's videos from our archives, with quick and easy organizational tips that will have you wondering: why didn't I think of that?

More
item.author: Nancy Mitchell

item.title: Cynthia's Calm Retreat Bedroom — My Bedroom Retreat Contest
item.description:
Like this My Bedroom Retreat contest entry? Favorite it below!
Name:
Cynthia
Location:
Toronto Canada
Division:
International
What do you love about your bedroom?:
I love that our bedroom is a calm retreat in a sea of constant excitement. With three young children, jobs, and lots on the go, my husband Graham and I wanted to create a sanctuary. For us, that meant a soft palette of whites and greys, a comfortable splurge bed that’s big enough for the whole family to snuggle in, a statement piece of art, over-scaled lighting, and fabulous storage.


More
item.author: Jason Loper
